results.title: Creating with clay
results.brief_description: A teacher demonstrates wire and spiral wedging using nylon to string to divide clay. Students create spontaneously - pinch bowls, coil pot, slab draping and decorating, fist forms, texturing and string sculpture.
results.description: A teacher demonstrates wire and spiral wedging using nylon to string to divide clay. Students create spontaneously - pinch bowls, coil pot, slab draping and decorating, fist forms, texturing and string sculpture.

results.title: Created equal
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Milton Friedman discusses freedom and equality, arguing that a society which maximises the scope for individual choice and action will be more successful at creating equal opportunities for all than a society which seeks to achieve quality through distribution of wealth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.description: Milton Friedman discusses freedom and equality, arguing that a society which maximises the scope for individual choice and action will be more successful at creating equal opportunities for all than a society which seeks to achieve quality through distribution of wealth.

results.title: Cream of the Coal Coast
results.brief_description: An insight into what constitutes the make-up of a pioneer mining town, showing the spirit and will of the people - the reason for its evolution.

results.title: Crayon
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the wide techniques which may be used in working with crayons - notching, scratching, rubbing, grating and melting. Drawing can be on paper, wood, metal, glass and fabric. Shows artists creating brilliantly coloured and textures work.

results.title: Crayfish coast
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The isolated crayfishing settlement of Ngawi is at the eastern end of Cook Strait. This film looks at the livelihood of the crayfishermen and their families in the small stark settlement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Cray season
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: The crayfish, seen not as a table delicacy, but as a living creature whose survival is threatened. Briefly looks at its life history, its vulnerability, its predators, and man its greatest enemy. Feild researchers take the camera underwater to the world of ‘Janus Lalander’, the southern crayfish.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rodney Musch, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit

results.title: Cranwell: the Royal Air Force College
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Ian Latimer and Rank Organisation Short Films Group
results.brief_description: Eighteen thousand new officers are commissioned annually into the R.A.F. Those who come from the Cranwell Royal Air Force College set an especially high standard. Cadets are trained as pilots and navigators and for the specialist branches - Technical, Secretarial, Equipment, and the R.A.F. Regiment. Great emphasis is placed on leaderhship in all branches, and on the high quality instruction. Cadets commissioned from Cromwell have every chance of getting to the top.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Eady, Ian Latimer and Rank Organisation Short Films Group

results.title: Craftsmen young and old
results.brief_description: A screen magazine containing three items: “Man who makes monsters” Dinosaurs, towering reptiles and other prehistoric creatures, all made of concrete by John Kanerva, turn Calgary Park into a primeval zoo; “All the family carves” Visit to the home workshop of Andre Bourgault, famous French-Canadian sculptor, whose children are learning his craft; “Last of the totem makers” Chief Mango Martin and his son preserve in their carving of totem poles, a unique art of Canada’s Pacific coast Indians.

results.title: Crafts in Australia
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australia Council
results.brief_description: This is a semi-promotional film made for the Crafts Council of Australia. Shows Australian craftsmen and women and their ideas, motivation and life style. Mirka Mora briefly features.
